newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila's PHIBOR rates mixed on year-end tightness.
newsitem.headline: Manila's PHIBOR rates mixed on year-end tightness.

text.p: Philippine interbank offered rates (PHIBOR) showed mixed results on Tuesday, with the one-week, one-month and one-year maturities declining while the two-month and three-month rose, traders said.
Dealers said there was more demand for two-month and three-month pesos due to the expected seasonal tightness in liquidity by year-end.
This prompted banks to raise their swap rates for the two and three-month maturities.
"Banks see tightness during December. They're positioning for that period," a trader said.
PHIBOR represents rates at which banks are willing to swap their pesos for dollars.
